title: Chapda Chutney
subtitle: Spicy red ant chutney
description: Known as *Chapda*, this fiery red ant chutney is a traditional delicacy of the Bastar tribes. Made from dried red ants and their eggs, it's rich in formic acid and believed to cure ailments like fever and cough. The sharp, tangy taste combined with local spices makes it a truly unique culinary experience.

title: Mahua Daru
subtitle: Traditional flower wine
description: Brewed from the fragrant flowers of the Mahua tree, this traditional wine is central to tribal culture. It is consumed during festivals, weddings, and social gatherings as a sacred offering and a community drink.

title: Mahua Gathering
subtitle: Forest produce livelihood
description: The collection of Mahua flowers is not just an economic activity but a seasonal event involving entire families. The flowers are dried and stored for year-round consumption and trade.
